channel.title: August 21, 2010 Mt. Timpanogos Hike
channel.description: Aaron and I hiked the Timpooneke trail to the main summit of Mt. Timpanogos (11,750’)

item.title: We live on the lower western slope of Mt. Timpanogos at 5,00 ft. This is a view of the mountain from our driveway on Sunday, Aug. 22, 2010.
item.iweb:richTitle: We live on the lower western slope of Mt. Timpanogos at 5,00 ft. This is a view of the mountain from our driveway on Sunday, Aug. 22, 2010.

item.title: Aaron & I are about a quarter of the way to the top. You can see the trail and a switchback in the center-left portion of the photo. We started at the very center of the photo.
item.iweb:richTitle: Aaron & I are about a quarter of the way to the top. You can see the trail and a switchback in the center-left portion of the photo. We started at the very center of the photo.

item.title: View of the trail
item.iweb:richTitle: View of the trail

item.title: Aaron
item.iweb:richTitle: Aaron

item.title: Greg
item.iweb:richTitle: Greg

item.title: Another shot of the trail, looking north. You can see Box Elder Peak in the mid-background with Pfeiferhorn in the far background.
item.iweb:richTitle: Another shot of the trail, looking north. You can see Box Elder Peak in the mid-background with Pfeiferhorn in the far background.

item.title: Looking down the mountainside. We are maybe halfway up to the peak.
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking down the mountainside. We are maybe halfway up to the peak.

item.title: This is just after getting to the first of the high plateaus with the main peak in the background. We’re at about 10,000 ft.
item.iweb:richTitle: This is just after getting to the first of the high plateaus with the main peak in the background. We’re at about 10,000 ft.

item.title: Trail ascending to the next plateau
item.iweb:richTitle: Trail ascending to the next plateau

item.title: Once on the next plateau, this is the trail that leads up to the ridgeline
item.iweb:richTitle: Once on the next plateau, this is the trail that leads up to the ridgeline

item.title: Looking back down the trail once we’re part way up the trail
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking back down the trail once we’re part way up the trail

item.title: Now we’re on the the trail that goes from the Saddle (not the same saddle as labeled in the first picture) to the peak
item.iweb:richTitle: Now we’re on the the trail that goes from the Saddle (not the same saddle as labeled in the first picture) to the peak

item.title: Looking back from the same spot to the Saddle
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking back from the same spot to the Saddle

item.title: Looking back from further up the trail
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking back from further up the trail

item.title: Now we’re about to ascend something that I think is called the Stairwell. It was pretty wild, but not too difficult.
item.iweb:richTitle: Now we’re about to ascend something that I think is called the Stairwell. It was pretty wild, but not too difficult.

item.title: Looking down the Stairwell
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking down the Stairwell

item.title: Past the Stairwell and looking toward the peak
item.iweb:richTitle: Past the Stairwell and looking toward the peak

item.title: This is the final part of the trail to the peak. In the upper righthand corner you can barely see the metal hut at the peak.
item.iweb:richTitle: This is the final part of the trail to the peak. In the upper righthand corner you can barely see the metal hut at the peak.

item.title: Looking back down the trail after getting part way to the peak
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking back down the trail after getting part way to the peak

item.title: At the peak at last! This is looking southwest down into Utah Valley. You can see the top of Big Baldy in the middle of the photo and Utah lake in the background.
item.iweb:richTitle: At the peak at last! This is looking southwest down into Utah Valley. You can see the top of Big Baldy in the middle of the photo and Utah lake in the background.

item.title: Looking east from the summit down to Emerald Lake
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking east from the summit down to Emerald Lake

item.title: Here is the metal hut. There is a registration book that you can sign. Thumbing through it, most of the signers were in their 20’s with a few in their 50’s. I saw a 60 year old, and, amazingly, a 76 yr old!
item.iweb:richTitle: Here is the metal hut. There is a registration book that you can sign. Thumbing through it, most of the signers were in their 20’s with a few in their 50’s. I saw a 60 year old, and, amazingly, a 76 yr old!

item.title: Aaron and I. I counted 50 people on the summit when we got there. On our way up we passed several hundred people going down. As the last Saturday before school starts, lots of people were doing the hike
item.iweb:richTitle: Aaron and I. I counted 50 people on the summit when we got there. On our way up we passed several hundred people going down. As the last Saturday before school starts, lots of people were doing the hike

item.title: Looking to the south...
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking to the south...

item.title: ...and more towards the southeast...
item.iweb:richTitle: ...and more towards the southeast...

item.title: ...and now to the east. It was very windy and somewhat cold, which was refreshing after the hike up!
item.iweb:richTitle: ...and now to the east. It was very windy and somewhat cold, which was refreshing after the hike up!

item.title: Now we’re going to follow this trail to the south along the summit ridgeline. Aaron and I ran most of it. That was by far the most amazing run I have ever done!
item.iweb:richTitle: Now we’re going to follow this trail to the south along the summit ridgeline. Aaron and I ran most of it. That was by far the most amazing run I have ever done!

item.title: Part way along the trail looking back (difficult to see) ...
item.iweb:richTitle: Part way along the trail looking back (difficult to see) ...

item.title: ... and looking forward.
item.iweb:richTitle: ... and looking forward.

item.title: Aaron
item.iweb:richTitle: Aaron

item.title: At one point the trail forked and we went left. When we came to a drop-off, we realized we should have gone right. Some guys behind us said you can climb down so we decided to follow them.
item.iweb:richTitle: At one point the trail forked and we went left. When we came to a drop-off, we realized we should have gone right. Some guys behind us said you can climb down so we decided to follow them.

item.title: Here’s Aaron starting to put his foot over the edge.
item.iweb:richTitle: Here’s Aaron starting to put his foot over the edge.

item.title: Now he’s about to go down. Note the grin--this is fun!
item.iweb:richTitle: Now he’s about to go down. Note the grin--this is fun!

item.title: Here I am coming down
item.iweb:richTitle: Here I am coming down

item.title: We made it to the top of the snowfield (labeled “Saddle” in the first picture) and began our descent
item.iweb:richTitle: We made it to the top of the snowfield (labeled “Saddle” in the first picture) and began our descent

item.title: Part way down looking back up
item.iweb:richTitle: Part way down looking back up

item.title: Most of the way down looking back up
item.iweb:richTitle: Most of the way down looking back up

item.title: It was pretty fun getting down the snow, although rather slippery
item.iweb:richTitle: It was pretty fun getting down the snow, although rather slippery

item.title: Emerald Lake
item.iweb:richTitle: Emerald Lake

item.title: Plateau next to Emerald Lake. Note the animals in the middle of the picture...
item.iweb:richTitle: Plateau next to Emerald Lake. Note the animals in the middle of the picture...

item.title: ... a momma mountain goat with her baby!
item.iweb:richTitle: ... a momma mountain goat with her baby!

item.title: There were a bunch of mountain goats. They were clearly quite used to people
item.iweb:richTitle: There were a bunch of mountain goats. They were clearly quite used to people

item.title: Now we hiked from Emerald Lake toward the Timpooneke trail
item.iweb:richTitle: Now we hiked from Emerald Lake toward the Timpooneke trail

item.title: Looking back on part of the trail
item.iweb:richTitle: Looking back on part of the trail

item.title: About to reach the trail junction
item.iweb:richTitle: About to reach the trail junction

item.title: Now we are ready to drop off the plateau region and continue our run back to the truck. Here’s Aaron...
item.iweb:richTitle: Now we are ready to drop off the plateau region and continue our run back to the truck. Here’s Aaron...

item.title: ...and me. The run was amazing. I used my walking sticks to lesson the impact on my right knee. Aaron said I looked like a spider running down the trail. Fine with me so long as I could do the run!
item.iweb:richTitle: ...and me. The run was amazing. I used my walking sticks to lesson the impact on my right knee. Aaron said I looked like a spider running down the trail. Fine with me so long as I could do the run!
